public final class zeta.util.Slot

(source file: Slot.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.util.Slot
The pure class interface. 
public final class Slot
  implements Serializable
A Slot defines an entry for storing objects in an annotation. To add a new slot one typically uses the following code: 
   class Foo{
      public static final slot = 
          Slot.register(Foo.class.getName(), Foo.class);
      public static Foo get(Annotation an){ 
          return (Foo)slot.get(an); 
      }
      public static boolean isProvided(Annotation an){ 
          return slot.isProvided(an); 
      }
      public static Annotation set(Annotation an, Foo foo){ 
         return slot.set(an, foo);
      }
      ... specific fields of Foo ...
   }

Author:
wg@cs.tu-berlin.de
Version: $Id: Slot.pizza,v 1.1.1.1 1998/09/01 10:51:12 wg Exp $

hideInFormat
A flag which controls wether this slot should be excluded from annotation formatting.

Return the slot associated with index.

Return application-unique index of this annotation slot.

Return maximal index currently assinged to a slot.

Return name of this annotation slot.

Return type of this annotation slot.

Register a new annotation slot

hideInFormat
public boolean hideInFormat;
A flag which controls wether this slot should be excluded from annotation formatting.

register
public static Slot register(String name,
                            Class type)
  throws IllegalArgumentException;
Register a new annotation slot. If a slot of the given name is already registered, it will be returned.

Parameters:
name - the name which identifies this annotation slot
type - the type of the object to be stored in the slot
Returns:
the slot object
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if a slot of this name is already registered, and the given type is not a subclass of the registered type

getName

public String getName();
Return name of this annotation slot.

getType

public Class getType();
Return type of this annotation slot.

getIndex

public int getIndex();
Return application-unique index of this annotation slot.

getMaxIndex

public static int getMaxIndex();
Return maximal index currently assinged to a slot.

forIndex

public static Slot forIndex(int index);
Return the slot associated with index.

get

public Object get(Annotation an);
Get the value associated with this slot in annotation.

isProvided

public boolean isProvided(Annotation an);
Test whether the value associated with this slot is provided by annotation.

put

public void put(Annotation an,
                Object object);
Set the value associated with this slot in annotation.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if object is not an instance of slot type.
